page.title: 11Green Chain Walk
page.content: The Green Chain Walk is a signposted pathway through south-east London and North Kent,keeping to areas of open-space,woodland,golf courses etc.It was opened in June 1983 by the deputy leader of the Greater London Council,Mr.Iltyd Harrington. In our block it passes though Oxleas Wood,across Shooters Hill and then through farmland near the WE ANCHOR IN HOPE pub.It then passes behind the School in Hillview Drive-Westwood school-and over Fanny-on-the-Hill. The whole walk is about 15 miles long from the River Thames to Beckenham.There are many historically interesting places outside our block,like Sevendroog Castle,Eltham Palace,and Monastery Ruins at Lessnes Abbey Woods.
